intro: Franseria camphorata var. leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf franseria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and herbal practices.
